title: 2015 Australian Grand Prix
summary: The 2015 Australian Grand Prix, formally titled the 2015 Formula 1 Rolex Australian Grand Prix,[2] was a Formula One motor race that was held on 15 March 2015 in Melbourne. The race was contested over fifty-eight laps of the Melbourne Grand Prix Circuit and was the first round of the 2015 FIA Formula One World Championship.[4][5] The race marked the 80th race in the combined history of the Australian Grand Prix – which dates back to the 100 Miles Road Race of 1928 – and the 20th time the event was held at the Melbourne Grand Prix Circuit.[6]
